title: Authors and Citation
text: Gregory Jefferis. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jefferis G (2022). malecns: Access latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets. https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns, https://flyconnectome.github.io/malecns/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets},   author = {Gregory Jefferis},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns, https://flyconnectome.github.io/malecns/}, }

what: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: goal malecns provide http://natverse.org/ style access latest datasets Janelia FlyEM. presently thin wrapper around malevnc package. goal due course provide slightly flexible setup cope

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: can install released version malecns GitHub

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: example shows read meshes, look ids position transform positions FlyWire/FAFB14.
code: library(malecns) ## read meshes for some annotated neurons  gs="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13e2yboGmSHrkdew0REkqXWrx5PfHrwPbZZArySjIHtA/edit?usp=sharing" mca=googlesheets4::read_sheet(gs) # update bodyids based on XYZ position mca$position=mcns_xyz2bodyid(mca$position)  confirmed_neurondf=subset(mca, !is.na(ontology)) ml=read_mcns_meshes(confirmed_neurondf) plot3d(ml, col=symbol)  library(natverse) library(fafbseg) # transform a point in FlyWire voxel space to malecns voxel space # and put it on the clipbaord ready to paste into neuroglancer clipr::write_clip(xform_brain(cbind(109953, 50450, 1660)*c(4,4,40),    reference = 'malecns',   sample = 'FlyWire')/8)

what: Surface model of the cortex (rind) of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
title: Surface model of the cortex (rind) of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
text: Surface model cortex (rind) malecns brain (nm)

title: Surface model of the cortex (rind) of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
Surface model of the cortex (rind) of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
text: object class hxsurf (inherits list) length 4.

title: Surface model of the cortex (rind) of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
code: # \donttest{ library(nat) #> Loading required package: rgl #> Some nat functions depend on a CMTK installation. See ?cmtk and README.md for details. #>  #> Attaching package: ‘nat’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:rgl’: #>  #>     wire3d #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, union boundingbox(malecns_shell.surf) #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #> [1,]  16898.1  31849.1  26324.4 #> [2,] 750590.0 441841.0 460357.0 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "boundingbox" # } if (FALSE) { plot3d(malecns_shell.surf, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in microns plot3d(malecns_shell.surf/1e3, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in raw voxels plot3d(malecns_shell.surf*(8/1e3), alpha=.2, col='grey') # mesh3d gives more flexibility plot3d(as.mesh3d(malecns_shell.surf), alpha=.2, col='grey', type='wire', add=T) }

what: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: Connectivity query CNS neurons

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
code: mcns_connection_table(   ids,   partners = c("inputs", "outputs"),   moredetails = TRUE,   summary = FALSE,   conn = mcns_neuprint(),   ... )

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: ids set body ids (see manc_ids range ways specify ). partners Either inputs outputs. Redundant prepost, probably clearer. moredetails yet implemented summary Whether summarise results per partner giving multiple query neurons conn Optional, neuprint_connection object, also specifies neuPrint server. Defaults manc_neuprint() ensure query VNC dataset. ... additional arguments passed neuprint_connection_table

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: data.frame

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
code: # \donttest{ joffrey.id=mcns_xyz2bodyid(cbind(24590, 13816, 26102)+4096, node = 'neuprint') joffrey.ds=mcns_connection_table(joffrey.id, partners = 'in') joffrey.dss=mcns_connection_table(joffrey.id, partners = 'in', summary=TRUE) # } if (FALSE) { # open top 10 partners in neuroglancer, # NB segmentation / meshes to match neuprint mcns_scene(joffrey.dss$partner[1:10], open = TRUE, node='neuprint') }

what: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: Login male CNS neuprint server

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: token Optional neuprint access token (see details examples trouble multiple tokens). Force Whether force new login CATMAID server (default FALSE) ... Additional arguments passed neuprint_login

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: neuprint_connection object returned neuprint_login

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: possible use token across public   private neuprint servers using email address. However   seem work users. giving , try   using recently issued token private server (e.g. cns   dataset) rather older tokens e.g. hemibrain dataset. need   pass specific token can use token argument, also   setting Force=T ensure specified token used   already tried log current session. See examples   code.

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
code: if (FALSE) { cnsc=mcns_neuprint()  # log in using specified token rather than the one in the neuprint_token # environment variable. This should then be cached for the rest of the R # session. cnsc=mcns_neuprint(token="XXX", Force=T)  anchorids <- neuprintr::neuprint_ids("status:Anchor", conn=cnsc) # the last connection will be used by default anchormeta <- neuprintr::neuprint_get_meta("status:Anchor")  plot(cumsum(sort(anchormeta$pre, decreasing = TRUE)), ylab='Cumulative presynapses') plot(cumsum(sort(anchormeta$post, decreasing = TRUE)), ylab='Cumulative postsynapses') }
